body:
@guyuqi Thanks for your review, but the smoke tests succeed on my machine for Fedora-36
```
./docker-hadoop.sh -d -C config_fedora-36.yaml --create 3 --memory 4g --repo file:///bigtop-home/output --disable-gpg-check --enable-local-repo --stack yarn,hdfs,spark --smoke-tests spark
```

```
Gradle Test Executor 2 started executing tests.

> Task :bigtop-tests:smoke-tests:spark:test

org.apache.bigtop.itest.spark.TestSpark > testSparkSQL STANDARD_OUT
    SPARK_MASTER isn't set. yarn will be used as the master URL. Refer to smoke-tests/README If this isn't what you you expect.

org.apache.bigtop.itest.spark.TestSpark > testSparkR STANDARD_OUT
    SPARK_MASTER isn't set. yarn will be used as the master URL. Refer to smoke-tests/README If this isn't what you you expect.

Gradle Test Executor 2 finished executing tests.

> Task :bigtop-tests:smoke-tests:spark:test
Finished generating test XML results (0.01 secs) into: /bigtop-home/bigtop-tests/smoke-tests/spark/build/test-results/test
Generating HTML test report...
Finished generating test html results (0.019 secs) into: /bigtop-home/bigtop-tests/smoke-tests/spark/build/reports/tests/test
Now testing...
:bigtop-tests:smoke-tests:spark:test (Thread[Execution worker for ':' Thread 2,5,main]) completed. Took 1 mins 20.387 secs.

BUILD SUCCESSFUL in 3m 21s
30 actionable tasks: 7 executed, 23 up-to-date
Stopped 1 worker daemon(s).
+ rm -rf buildSrc/build/test-results/binary
+ rm -rf /bigtop-home/.gradle
```

The timeout of Spark smoke tests was expired. Maybe it caused by my limited hardware resource in my local host.(VM)
Thank you for verify this PR on Fedora 36.  @kevinw66 

+1 LGTM.
Merged. Thanks @kevinw66

@timyuer 
Would any other commits be added to this PRï¼Ÿ

> @timyuer Would any other commits be added to this PRï¼Ÿ

No.

> > @timyuer Would any other commits be added to this PRï¼Ÿ
> 
> No.


Thanks. LGTM +1.

As talked with @kevinw66 ,  I'd like merge this to master.
Because `bigtop-select` is just only used for Ambari-2.8 and it only supports RPMs in Bigtop, I would disable the component [bigtop-select](https://github.com/apache/bigtop/blob/master/bigtop.bom#L261) in Bigtop-3.2 (Branch-3.2).  
Ambari guys could fetch our Bigtop-3.2 release source code and enbale `bigtop-select` component  by themselves.
LGTM. +1
Thanks! Merged into master.

Thanks for working on it. @yoda-mon 

Successfully built gpdb on Fedora-36 for x86/Arm64 with Bigtop `jenkins` user.
And smoke tests on Fedora-36 were also passed.
```
Successfully started process 'Gradle Test Executor 2'

Gradle Test Executor 2 started executing tests.
Gradle Test Executor 2 finished executing tests.

> Task :bigtop-tests:smoke-tests:kafka:test
Finished generating test XML results (0.014 secs) into: /bigtop-home/bigtop-tests/smoke-tests/kafka/build/test-results/test

```

```

+1, LGTM
Merged, thanks @yoda-mon
I Confirmed that it would successfully build related docker images and Hadoop on ppcle64.
LGTM, +1
Merged, thanks.

For bigtop commiters might haven't local ppc64le host to test this PR,  I confirmed it could be successfully built on Debian-11, Fedora-36, Centos-7 and ubuntu-22.04/20.04 on Bigtop ppc64le CI node; Smoke tests were passed on Centos-7.
Thanks, merged to master and branch-3.2.
Good catch , let me rebuild Ambari metrics and try to deploy Mpack. thanks.

It could be successfully deploy mpack:
![1671788392620](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20575685/209311915-bd457541-b331-4778-9ab3-f5c1cc1f0ace.png)

The grafana-server version is 9.3.2:
```
[root@ambari-agent-01 bin]# pwd
/usr/lib/ambari-metrics-grafana/bin
[root@ambari-agent-01 bin]# ./grafana-server -v
Version 9.3.2 (commit: 21c1d14e91, branch: HEAD)
```


LGTM, +1
Merged to master and cherry pick it to branch-3.2, thanks @kevinw66

I tested this on CentOS 7, Rocky Linux 8, Fedora 36, Ubuntu 20.04 and Ubuntu 22.04 on x86_64 like:

```
$ ./docker-hadoop.sh \
       --create 1 \
       --image bigtop/puppet:trunk-rockylinux-8 \
       --memory 16g \
       --disable-gpg-check \
       --stack kerberos
```

+1, tested on Debian 11.

```
$ ./docker-hadoop.sh -dcp -d -C config_debian-11.yaml -F docker-compose-cgroupv2.yml -G -k kerberos -c 1

...

Notice: /Stage[main]/Kerberos::Kdc/Service[krb5-kdc]/ensure: ensure changed 'stopped' to 'running'

...

Notice: /Stage[main]/Kerberos::Kdc::Admin_server/Service[krb5-admin-server]/ensure: ensure changed 'stopped' to 'running'
```
Thanks @iwasakims, merged into master and branch-3.2.

I tested the patch with following deployment on Rocky Linux 8 x86_64.

```
hadoop::hadoop_security_authentication: "kerberos"
kerberos::krb_site::domain: "bigtop.apache.org"
kerberos::krb_site::realm: "BIGTOP.APACHE.ORG"
kerberos::krb_site::kdc_server: "%{hiera('bigtop::hadoop_head_node')}"
kerberos::krb_site::kdc_port: "88"
kerberos::krb_site::admin_port: "749"
kerberos::krb_site::keytab_export_dir: "/var/lib/bigtop_keytabs"
hadoop::kerberos_realm: "%{hiera('kerberos::krb_site::realm')}"
hadoop::hadoop_ssl_hostname_verifier: "ALLOW_ALL"
hadoop::hadoop_http_authentication_type: "%{hiera('hadoop::hadoop_security_authentication')}"
hadoop::hadoop_http_authentication_signature_secret: changeit
```

```
$ ./docker-hadoop.sh \
       --create 1 \
       --image bigtop/puppet:trunk-rockylinux-8 \
       --memory 16g \
       --repo file:///bigtop-home/output \
       --disable-gpg-check \
       --stack kerberos,hdfs
```

HTTPS with Kerberos auth worked as expected:

```
# kinit -kt /etc/hdfs.keytab
# hdfs dfs -ls swebhdfs://$(hostname --fqdn):50475/
Found 7 items
drwxr-xr-x   - hdfs  hadoop          0 2023-02-03 15:03 swebhdfs://13cd26a5ecef.bigtop.apache.org:50475/apps
drwxrwxrwx   - hdfs  hadoop          0 2023-02-03 15:03 swebhdfs://13cd26a5ecef.bigtop.apache.org:50475/benchmarks
drwxr-xr-x   - hbase hbase           0 2023-02-03 15:03 swebhdfs://13cd26a5ecef.bigtop.apache.org:50475/hbase
drwxr-xr-x   - solr  solr            0 2023-02-03 15:03 swebhdfs://13cd26a5ecef.bigtop.apache.org:50475/solr
drwxrwxrwt   - hdfs  hadoop          0 2023-02-03 15:03 swebhdfs://13cd26a5ecef.bigtop.apache.org:50475/tmp
drwxr-xr-x   - hdfs  hadoop          0 2023-02-03 15:03 swebhdfs://13cd26a5ecef.bigtop.apache.org:50475/user
drwxr-xr-x   - hdfs  hadoop          0 2023-02-03 15:03 swebhdfs://13cd26a5ecef.bigtop.apache.org:50475/var

# hdfs dfs -put /bigtop-home/README.md swebhdfs://$(hostname --fqdn):50475/tmp/
# curl -L -k --negotiate -u : "https://$(hostname --fqdn):50475/webhdfs/v1/tmp/README.md?op=OPEN"
[![Travis CI](https://img.shields.io/travis/apache/bigtop.svg?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.org/apache/bigtop)

Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one or more
...
```

I saw no regression on running smoke-tests of Hadoop without Kerberos security.

```
$ ./docker-hadoop.sh \
       --create 3 \
       --image bigtop/puppet:trunk-rockylinux-8 \
       --memory 8g \
       --repo file:///bigtop-home/output \
       --disable-gpg-check \
       --stack hdfs,yarn,mapreduce \
       --smoke-tests hdfs,yarn,mapreduce
...
BUILD SUCCESSFUL in 13m 27s
37 actionable tasks: 12 executed, 25 up-to-date
Stopped 1 worker daemon(s).
+ rm -rf buildSrc/build/test-results/binary
+ rm -rf /bigtop-home/.gradle
```
+1ï¼Œ LGTM
Thanks, @guyuqi.

@guyuqi the part of this fix is already contained in branch-3.2 by 486a27d4aa9acbf2182e3a69a2b2c264238a71e5. We should avoid to mix manual with the result of `./gradlew setversion` because it makes cherry-picking confusing.

The added http.keystore was created by keytool as 

```
$ keytool -keystore ./http.keystore -genkey -alias http -keyalg RSA -storepass changeit -keypass changeit -dname "CN=localhost, OU=Unknown, O=Unknown, L=Unknown, ST=Unknown, C=Unknown"
```

@MacChen02 
Thank you for the PR. I tried to buiild and test your PR, but it seemed failed. Could you describe how you tested your patch ?

```sh
# On Rocky Linux 8, ARM64 hostmachine
./gradlew -POS=fedora-36 -Pdocker-run-option="--privileged" alluxio-clean alluxio-pkg-ind bigtop-utils-pkg-ind repo-ind
cd provisioner/docker
./docker-hadoop.sh -d --create 1 -F docker-compose-cgroupv2.yml -C config_fedora-36.yaml --enable-local-repo --repo file:///bigtop-home/output  --disable-gpg-check  --stack alluxio --smoke-tests alluxio

...

Error: Could not update: Execution of '/usr/bin/dnf -d 0 -e 1 -y install alluxio' returned 1: Error: 
 Problem: conflicting requests
  - nothing provides libc.so.6(GLIBC_2.2.5)(64bit) needed by alluxio-2.8.0-2.fc36.aarch64
  - nothing provides libpthread.so.0(GLIBC_2.2.5)(64bit) needed by alluxio-2.8.0-2.fc36.aarch64
Error: /Stage[main]/Alluxio::Common/Package[alluxio]/ensure: change from 'purged' to 'latest' failed: Could not update: Execution of '/usr/bin/dnf -d 0 -e 1 -y install alluxio' returned 1: Error: 
 Problem: conflicting requests
  - nothing provides libc.so.6(GLIBC_2.2.5)(64bit) needed by alluxio-2.8.0-2.fc36.aarch64
  - nothing provides libpthread.so.0(GLIBC_2.2.5)(64bit) needed by alluxio-2.8.0-2.fc36.aarch64
```

The error log show the version of GLIBC needs 2.2.5ï¼Œwhich version do you have?

The version in my env is:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/58972037/218660550-415cd175-818f-46ba-809a-b44dd155852d.png)

dnf install binutils

```sh
# check the patch is applied
cat bigtop-home/bigtop-packages/src/common/alluxio/do-component-build |grep sed
# Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one or more
  sed -i "s|<nodeVersion>v10.11.0</nodeVersion>|<nodeVersion>v12.22.1</nodeVersion>|" webui/pom.xml
  sed -i "s|<npmVersion>6.4.1</npmVersion>|<npmVersion>6.14.7</npmVersion>|" webui/pom.xml
    sed -i "s|<nodeVersion>v10.11.0</nodeVersion>|<nodeVersion>v12.22.1</nodeVersion>|" webui/pom.xml

    sed -i "s|<activeByDefault>false</activeByDefault>|<activeByDefault>true</activeByDefault>|g" integration/jnifuse/native/pom.xml
```
If you tested on baremetals or VMs, it might be the cause of difference.

@yoda-mon We solved this problem in the process of adapting the openEuler OS, the  JIRA is:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BIGTOP-3881
@MacChen02 Same error occured and failed. I guess `do-component-build` does not recognize the OS.

@MacChen02 
After cheking around this, I found you have to include `libfuse3` related libraries to tool chain.
cf.  https://github.com/yoda-mon/bigtop/pull/2/files#diff-9337fb34935804ab7b56cd89ae94e14491ad4c64804daa9b1843eeec336772ed
After adding these the error above seemed solved.  I guess you tested your patch on your customized environment.
Could you check again and update the PR message with how you test your patch ?  I recommend you to follow the PR template for checking the reproducibility.

AFAIK, Spark is moving to rocksdb in recently version, and leveldb is not a hard dependency, instead of a workaround for leveldb, how do you think switching to rocksdb by changing the default configurations?

@guluo2016 Could you increment [the release number of the package](https://github.com/apache/bigtop/blob/dc4fe2d6655b3b3f1257f947203fd851a51c1b08/bigtop.bom#L138) to 3? Already released Bigtop 3.2.0 [bundles zookeeper as zookeeper-3.5.9-2](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BIGTOP-3724).

@iwasakims   Increaseing [the release number of zookeeper](https://github.com/apache/bigtop/blob/dc4fe2d6655b3b3f1257f947203fd851a51c1b08/bigtop.bom#L138) to 3. Does this mean that other components also need to be updated? For example, hadoop, hive, etc.
Because [the release number of hadoop](https://github.com/apache/bigtop/blob/master/bigtop.bom#L154) is not 3

@guluo2016
> Does this mean that other components also need to be updated? For example, hadoop, hive, etc.

No.

We need to increment the release number if we modify package contents without bumping the version of the product. The package version of ZooKeeper packaged by Bigtop 3.2.0 is 3.5.9-2. If we release Bigtop 3.2.1 now, the version will be 3.5.9-3. It implies that the package contents was changed within zookeeper-3.5.9 and we can upgrade installed package by `rpm -U zookeeper` or `yum update zookeeper` (for RPM as example).

We don't need increment the release number of ZooKeeper again before releasing Bigtop 3.2.1 (or Biptop 3.3.0). We can reset the release number to 1 if we bump the ZooKeeper to 3.5.10 or later.

> @guluo2016
> 
> > Does this mean that other components also need to be updated? For example, hadoop, hive, etc.
> 
> No.
> 
> We need to increment the release number if we modify package contents without bumping the version of the product. The package version of ZooKeeper packaged by Bigtop 3.2.0 is 3.5.9-2. If we release Bigtop 3.2.1 now, the version will be 3.5.9-3. It implies that the package contents was changed within zookeeper-3.5.9 and we can upgrade installed package by `rpm -U zookeeper` or `yum update zookeeper` (for RPM as example).
> 
> We don't need increment the release number of ZooKeeper again before releasing Bigtop 3.2.1 (or Biptop 3.3.0). We can reset the release number to 1 if we bump the ZooKeeper to 3.5.10 or later.

Understanded!  thank you

> In addition, i found hbase is still normal even thoes soft link error, this is puzzling.

It works because [the classpath set by hbase CLI contains classpath of Hadoop](https://github.com/apache/hbase/blob/rel/2.4.13/bin/hbase#L337-L352), I guess.

```

/usr/lib/hbase
/usr/lib/hbase/lib/shaded-clients/hbase-shaded-client-byo-hadoop-2.4.13.jar

cd docker/bigtop-puppet/

cd provisioner/docker
./docker-hadoop.sh -d --create 1 -F docker-compose-cgroupv2.yml -C config_fedora-36.yaml --enable-local-repo --repo file:///bigtop-home/output  --disable-gpg-check  --stack alluxio --smoke-tests alluxio

We need fix for [toolchain](https://github.com/apache/bigtop/tree/master/bigtop_toolchain) too to support this on all supported distros/platforms.

Is the Zstandard licensed under the one we can bundle it by default?
https://www.apache.org/legal/resolved.html

> We need fix for [toolchain](https://github.com/apache/bigtop/tree/master/bigtop_toolchain) too to support this on all supported distros/platforms.

In bigtop_toolchain/manifests/packages.pp, libzstd-devel has been included, so anything else need to modify?

Thanks
Robin

> Is the Zstandard licensed under the one we can bundle it by default? https://www.apache.org/legal/resolved.html

By my understanding, this fix only make the hadoop native library compiled with pre-installed ZSTD binary, no ZSTD (GPL-2.0 license) code included in this repository.
If no zstd library present, this script will compile as before.

Thanks
Robin

> Is the Zstandard licensed under the one we can bundle it by default? https://www.apache.org/legal/resolved.html

zsdt's license is BSD (https://github.com/facebook/zstd/blob/dev/LICENSE).
As far as I know, Apache 2.0 license is compatible with BSD. (Pls correct me if I had misunderstanding)

> > Is the Zstandard licensed under the one we can bundle it by default? https://www.apache.org/legal/resolved.html
> 
> zsdt's license is BSD (https://github.com/facebook/zstd/blob/dev/LICENSE). As far as I know, Apache 2.0 license is compatible with BSD. (Pls correct me if I had misunderstanding)

aha, you are correct, i miss understood that zstd is GPL licensed.

> In bigtop_toolchain/manifests/packages.pp, libzstd-devel has been included, so anything else need to modify?

Oops. I forgot about [BIGTOP-3535](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BIGTOP-3535).

> By my understanding, this fix only make the hadoop native library compiled with pre-installed ZSTD binary, no ZSTD (GPL-2.0 license) code included in this repository.

We are publishing pre built packages for users' convenience. We can not link it against pre-built library if it is distributed under GPL. Zstandard seems to be dual-licensed under BSD and GPLv2. I'm not confident about which is applied to pre-built libzstd.so redistributed by OS distros.

@guyuqi 
After testing by myself and others, this error is reproducible.
How to reproduce:
Pull the centos-7 amd64 image in a new environment.
```
docker pull bigtop/slaves:3.2.0-centos-7
```
Delete the cache of your m2 repository, or test in a new machine environment.

It's tricky that I could not reproduce this issues on either a new clean x86 host or Arm's.
In Bigtop, the build process was supposed to be triggered by user` jenkins` in the related docker container except by `root`.  There maybe some dependency and cyclic reference issues with `root` when building Bigtop components.
Could you please switch user to `jenkins` and give it a shot?

@guluo2016 I guess the zkCli.sh was not used since the zookeeper is expected to be installed as package dependency. If the bundled script is crucial, you should add test case to smoke-tests for showing the use case.

> @guluo2016 I guess the zkCli.sh was not used since the zookeeper is expected to be installed as package dependency. If the bundled script is crucial, you should add test case to smoke-tests for showing the use case.

solr's zkcli.sh and zookeeper's zkCli.sh are different.

This is the content of zookeeper's zkCli.sh.
```shell
"$JAVA" "-Dzookeeper.log.dir=${ZOO_LOG_DIR}" "-Dzookeeper.root.logger=${ZOO_LOG4J_PROP}" "-Dzookeeper.log.file=${ZOO_LOG_FILE}" \
     -cp "$CLASSPATH" $CLIENT_JVMFLAGS $JVMFLAGS \
     org.apache.zookeeper.ZooKeeperMain "$@"
```

This is the content of solr's zkcli.sh.
```shell
PATH=$JAVA_HOME/bin:$PATH $JVM $SOLR_ZK_CREDS_AND_ACLS $ZKCLI_JVM_FLAGS -Dlog4j.configurationFile=$log4j_config \
-classpath "$sdir/../../solr-webapp/webapp/WEB-INF/lib/*:$sdir/../../lib/ext/*:$sdir/../../lib/*" org.apache.solr.cloud.ZkCLI ${1+"$@"}
```

solr's zkcli.sh is use to upload/download configs which is used by solr collection 
for exampleï¼š
```shell
zkcli.sh -zkhost localhost:9983 -cmd upconfig -confdir /opt/solr/collection1/conf -confname myconf
zkcli.sh -zkhost localhost:9983 -cmd downconfig -confdir /opt/solr/collection1/conf -confname myconf
```
Because zkcli.sh/zkcli.sh always executed directly, we should grant solr's zkcli.sh/zkcli.bat 755 permission.

**For smoke-testsï¼ŒI can try adding some test cases later in other tasks if there are necessary.**
ran smoke-tests of hive on Rocky Linux 8 (x86_64).
You can not reproduce the issue if you have cached artifact under `~/.m2/repository/org/pentaho`.

> conf-select is not needed for Ranger?

Indeed,  i find conf-select don't works in ambari 2.8.0/trunk
When intalling service or component, we can see following logs

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13212217/232365444-53ae4a5f-5cf9-4517-95da-4352ad8c65c8.png)

> > By my understanding, this fix only make the hadoop native library compiled with pre-installed ZSTD binary, no ZSTD (GPL-2.0 license) code included in this repository.
> 
> We are publishing pre built packages for users' convenience. We can not link it against pre-built library if it is distributed under GPL. Zstandard seems to be dual-licensed under BSD and GPLv2. I'm not confident about which is applied to pre-built libzstd.so redistributed by OS distros.

I could completely understand your concerns for `LICENSE`.  The terms of the license are too complicated to comprehend well.
Fortunately, it appears that Apache Spark does support ZSTD and Spark guys had updated `LICENSE `and `NOTICE `in [SPARK-24654](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SPARK-24654).
They provided the extra license statement in source tree: [LICENSE-binary-zstd](https://github.com/apache/spark/blob/master/licenses-binary/LICENSE-zstd.txt).
Shall we also create the similar LICENSE file for zstd binary in Bigtop?

What do you think of it? @iwasakims

Spark bundles pre-built binary of [zstd-jni](https://github.com/luben/zstd-jni) (containing zstd as part of it). I'm concerning about the license of libzstd binary distributed by OS distros here.

Thanks for working on it, @iwasakims 
I verified the Haddop and Hive smoke tests on Centos-7 and Fedora-36 successfully (x86_64 / Arm64).

However, when testing on Ubuntu 22.04, the deployment of Hive failed due to dependency issues.

`config_ubuntu-22.04.yaml` :

...
components: [bigtop-utils, zookeeper,hdfs, yarn, mapreduce, hive]
enable_local_repo: true
smoke_test_components: [hdfs, yarn, mapreduce, hive]
```
